title: Disconnect
body:
This is seriously a huge problem for me, so I'll split it in numbers.

1: Failure to join a game after champion select

This happens a few times, where I accepted my queue and it shows that I have accepted it but then its just stuck on the same screen. After a minute or two I manage to get into the game with some time to pick my champ, though unable to pick anything and after 5-10sec it says I failed to pick a champ. This then will make it as if i "dodged" a game which also means more queue time for me.

2: Attempting to reconnect multiple times in game

This is gamebreaking. Upon entering a game, I kept on getting this cycle of "Attempting to reconnect" which will only be fixed if I alt+f4 and reconnect manually. I have tried waiting for the system to reconnect me to the game but nothing really happens. At that time I can see what's happening in game but unable to move at all. While this is happening I usually have other stuff that are using my connection without any problem at all.

3: Is it my internet?

No, I don't think so as I stated above other program are running fine while I'm having this "Attempting to reconnect" issue in game.

4: How does this affect me?

Getting massive reports from players and flamed all the the time in game. Literally just wasting my time as I might be really damn close on getting this unranked account banned for something I'm unable to control.

TL;DR

Keep on dcing in game when internet is fine. Please, how do I fix this? {{item:3070}}

replies.body:
First off, test any possible solutions in a custom game, you won't get tagged for leaving/dcing those.

These could help:

- Check your firewall/anti-virus software settings, incase LoL is being blocked.
- Disable Peer-to-peer (it's in the gear icon of the cilent)
- Make sure Pando Media Booster isn't on your computer (it use it be part of LoL but got removed and since then has be hyjacked into adware/spamware)
- Try a full re-install, it might help in this situation, since you think it's not your internet doing this.

If that doesn't work, try sending in a support ticket. Also your system specs would be super usefull.
